visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing comparative percentages of nuclear and renewable energy production across top 10 countries using grouped columns with a triadic color scheme

title.text: Top 10 nuclear vs renewable energy producers (2011)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three-dimensional categorical data comparing energy production percentages (nuclear vs renewable) across 10 countries. Variables include country (nominal categorical), energy type (nominal categorical), and production percentage (ratio scale). Data is sourced from Wikipedia's verified electricity production statistics, ensuring real-world validity with natural variance in energy policies and geographical advantages. The column chart was selected to enable direct visual comparison of discrete categories through position encoding. Grouped columns maintain Tufte's data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant country labels across series. Cairo's principles are implemented through: 1) Pre-attentive color coding (triadic scheme) for immediate series differentiation 2) Spatial grouping of national data points 3) Direct percentage labeling via tooltips. Nuclear energy shows bimodal distribution (μ=19.1%, σ=21.8) with France (79.4%) as outlier, while renewable sources exhibit right-skewed distributions (Hydropower μ=12.9%, σ=16.4; Other renewable μ=7.8%, σ=11.9).
